citation.name: Phytochemicals as inhibitors of NF-κB for treatment of Alzheimer's disease.

links.evidence: Curcumin showed several anti-inﬂammatory characteristics. It deploys various cytokine-inhibitory, anti-inﬂammatory activities and decreases the expression levels of COX-2, LOX, and iNOS. Moreover, the expression of the pro-inﬂammatory cytokines, for instance, TNF-a, IL-1, -2,-6, -8, and -12 and the neurotoxic factors were suppressed by curcumin in lipopolysaccharide (LPS)-stimulated monocytes and alveolar macrophages [103].
